    66= Tasks =
    7 1. Create a MySQL database with provided movie info (on your development machine);
    8 2. Setup Apache Tomcat (on your development machine);
    9 3. Setup an Amazon AWS instance and repeat tasks 1-3 on the instance.
    10 4. Join Github Organization and create a repo for your team.
    11 5. Write the Movie List, Single Movie, and Single star page of the Fablix Application

    3228The table-creation SQL statements should be written in a '''createtable.sql''' file.  All varchar() fields for which there is no data (i.e., the fields contents are missing or unknown) are the empty string (!''); other non-required fields which have no data are null. Required fields have the constraint that they are not null. [[BR]] [[BR]]

    4337= Task 2.5: Apache Tomcat Eclipse Integration (Optional but Recommended) =
    44 
    4538Apache Tomcat makes hosting your applications easy. The Eclipse IDE makes development easy. Important: You may use Eclipse version 3.1 or higher or may opt to use Eclipse EE (EE stands for Enterprise Edition and has built-in support for application and web servers including Tomcat)

    5849= Task 3: Setup an AWS Instance to Repeat Tasks 1-2 =
    59 
    6050[[Span(id=setup-aws)]]You need to launch an Amazon [https://aws.amazon.com/console/ AWS instance] to repeat the tasks above. Make sure to use the '''free-tier 64-bit Ubuntu instances''' so that we can make our future instructions consistent. You are welcome to participate in the ​[https://aws.amazon.com/education/awseducate/ AWS Educate] program, which can provide $100 AWS credits per student. (I believe UCI is a member institution.)
    6151
    6252Generally, similar to many other tasks in this quarter, we expect you to figure out how to do many tasks by reading online materials.  [https://aws.amazon.com/free/ This] link is a good place to start from.
    6353
    64 
    6554== Launch a free AWS instance ==
    6655 1. Go to [https://aws.amazon.com/console/ AWS Console] to sign up. You will need to enter a valid credit card. Don't worry; as long as you choose a free-tier instance and remove it after the end of the quarter, you will not be charged.
    67  2. When you are done, login to the AWS console.
    68  3. Launch a new '''Ubuntu 14.04''' free-tier '''t2.micro''' instance. Notice that you need to generate and download a key to ssh to the machine, and it may take a few minutes for the instance to be initialized.
    69  4. After the instance is running, you will see a public IP address assigned to it. Keep this IP: you are required to give us this IP to demo project 1.
    70  5. When viewing the list of instances, you can click on the "connect" button, on the top to get instructions on how to use SSH to connect to the instance. By default, only the SSH port, 22, is open. In order to get other services (e.g., HTTP, HTTPS, and Tomcat) to be available to other machines, you will need to open the corresponding ports. '''To do so, when the instance is checked, select the security group, go to the "inbound" tab, and add more rules'''.
     56 1. When you are done, login to the AWS console.
     57 1. Launch a new '''Ubuntu 14.04''' free-tier '''t2.micro''' instance. Notice that you need to generate and download a key to ssh to the machine, and it may take a few minutes for the instance to be initialized.
     58 1. After the instance is running, you will see a public IP address assigned to it. Keep this IP: you are required to give us this IP to demo project 1.
     59 1. When viewing the list of instances, you can click on the "connect" button, on the top to get instructions on how to use SSH to connect to the instance. By default, only the SSH port, 22, is open. In order to get other services (e.g., HTTP, HTTPS, and Tomcat) to be available to other machines, you will need to open the corresponding ports. '''To do so, when the instance is checked, select the security group, go to the "inbound" tab, and add more rules'''.

    120107= Demonstration =
    121 
    122108'''You are required to demonstrate  this project'''. Create a running system from your ZIP file–quickly. Show the correctness, completeness, functionality and performance of your database during your demonstration by using the employee interface developed here. Your task is to convince us '''(in 15 minutes)''' that your work is correctly and completely carried out and the course project is ready to move to phase 2. Your demo will include the following:

Additionally, the TA/Reader may want to use his username (with the password that you provide) to access the instance through SSH.

    132118Please note that '''you will have no more than 15 min to demonstrate'''.  It is completely up to you to plan your demo so that all the required features are displayed and the grader  can be convinced of the quality of your work in the given time frame.''' If a group's demonstration appears to be unstructured, the demo could be aborted and rescheduled for another time''' with a substantial '''grade penalty'''.
